definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Ou-yang Xiu was a man of great importance in shaping the literati culture of the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳修在宋代士大夫新文化的型塑过程中极具影响力。

sentences.english: The consciousness of hardship was the self-knowledge to the scholar-bureaucrats in feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 忧患意识则是古代封建社会士大夫的一种人生自觉。

sentences.english: Scholar-officials in ancient China had bias on managing financial affaires.
sentences.chinese: 古代中国的士大夫，在“理财”方面素有偏见。

sentences.english: It is a notable phenomenon that scholar-bureaucrats henpecked in the Tang dynasty, Whose formation has deep social reasons.
sentences.chinese: 在唐代社会，士大夫惧内是一个值得关注的现象。

sentences.english: The second part discussed the scholar-officials'interaction between family and country in the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 论证宋代士大夫在家与国之间的互动。

definition: land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
